decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of milling and disruption tactics. The deck aims to quickly fill the opponent's graveyard by utilizing cards like Merfolk Windrobber, Ruin Crab, and Soaring Thought-Thief. It also includes creatures like Thieves' Guild Enforcer and removal spells like Heartless Act and Power Word Kill to disrupt the opponent's board state. The deck further enhances its control by countering spells with Disdainful Stroke and protecting its own important cards. It also has access to strong card draw spells like Into the Story to replenish its resources. The deck's land base includes multiple dual lands and Fabled Passage to ensure consistent access to the desired colors of mana.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the combo potential of Goldspan Dragon, Lore Drakkis, and Vadrok, Apex of Thunder to generate mana and recycle spells while disrupting the opponent's strategy with counter spells and removal. By leveraging these combo pieces with support from efficient spells and lands, this Jeskai Combo deck aims to control the game tempo and overwhelm the opponent with powerful plays and card advantage.

This Jeskai Combo deck utilizes powerful creatures like Lore Drakkis, Goldspan Dragon, and Vadrok, Apex of Thunder to create a winning combo. By utilizing spells like Seize the Spoils, Prismari Command, and Expressive Iteration to generate value and card advantage, the deck aims to control the board while setting up a game-winning combo. The deck also includes disruption spells like Negate and Mystical Dispute to protect the combo pieces. By carefully managing resources and timing plays, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its powerful combinations and card advantage.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Winota, Joiner of Forces and Elite Spellbinder to put pressure on the opponent early and often. By utilizing cards like Lotus Cobra and Prosperous Innkeeper to ramp up mana, this deck aims to quickly play powerful cards like Blade Historian and Minsc, Beloved Ranger to close out games before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. With a mix of removal and protection spells, as well as powerful lands like Lair of the Hydra, this deck can quickly overwhelm opponents and secure victories.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful creatures. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and stall the game until it can establish a dominant position with cards like Elder Gargaroth and Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider. The deck also utilizes Emergent Ultimatum and Yorion, Sky Nomad to generate value and card advantage. The mana base is built to support the deck's three-color requirements while also ensuring consistency in its mana sources.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build a board presence with aggressive creatures like Magda, Brazen Outlaw and Lovestruck Beast, while also generating value with cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and Jaspera Sentinel. The deck aims to apply pressure early on and close out the game quickly with powerful finishers like Embercleave and Goldspan Dragon. The mana base is optimized for consistency, with a mix of pathways to ensure access to all colors needed. Ranger Class provides additional value and the deck is supplemented with removal options like Bonecrusher Giant and Shatterskull Smashing.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful spells and creatures to control the board and outvalue the opponent. It includes a variety of removal spells like Heartless Act and Power Word Kill, as well as counter spells like Disdainful Stroke to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also features powerful threats like Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider and Elder Gargaroth to put pressure on the opponent. With the help of cards like Cultivate and Emergent Ultimatum, the deck aims to ramp up and quickly outpace the opponent for victory.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through countering spells, removing threats, and generating card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with a combination of counterspells like Negate and Essence Scatter, removal spells like Shatterskull Smashing and Scorching Dragonfire, and card draw/filtering effects like Omen of the Sea and Expressive Iteration. The deck also uses powerful finishers like Kiora Bests the Sea God and Shark Typhoon to close out the game. With Yorion, Sky Nomad as the companion, the deck can generate even more value with flicker effects.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counter spells and removal, while also generating card advantage with cards like Yorion, Sky Nomad and Expressive Iteration. The deck aims to stall the game until it can play its powerful win conditions such as Shark Typhoon and Kiora Bests the Sea God. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes a mix of lands for different situations. Overall, the strategy of the deck is to control the board and outvalue the opponent with powerful late-game plays.

The main idea of this Jeskai Combo deck is to utilize the combination of Vadrok, Apex of Thunder and Lore Drakkis to create a loop of casting and recasting cheap spells from the graveyard. By using cards like Expressive Iteration and See the Truth to dig through the deck, the player can assemble the necessary pieces for their combo. Additionally, disruptive spells like Unsubstantiate and Disdainful Stroke can help protect the combo pieces or disrupt the opponent's strategy. This deck aims to control the game by combining card advantage with powerful creatures and spells.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through removal spells, counterspells, and board wipes to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It aims to generate card advantage and outvalue the opponent by utilizing cards like Cultivate, Emergent Ultimatum, and Yorion, Sky Nomad. The key strategy is to survive the early game, stabilize the board, and ultimately win the game through powerful late-game threats like Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider and Alrund's Epiphany. The deck also uses its mana base efficiently with a mix of triomes and pathways to ensure smooth mana production.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and board wipes. By using cards like Negate, Power Word Kill, Heartless Act, and Shadows' Verdict, the deck aims to keep the opponent's board under control while ramping up with Cultivate and Emergent Ultimatum to access powerful threats like Vorinclex, Elder Gargaroth, and Alrund's Epiphany. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value by blinking permanents for extra card advantage and board presence. The deck utilizes a variety of lands to ensure consistent mana production to support its control strategy.
